org.obd.query.impl
Class RDFShard

java.lang.Object
  org.obd.query.impl.AbstractShard
      org.obd.query.impl.RDFShard
All Implemented Interfaces:
AnalysisCapableRepository, AnnotationRepository, BasicRepository, MutableRepository, QueryableRepository, SearchableRepository, Shard
public class RDFShard
extends AbstractShard
implements Shard

Implements a Shard by wrapping an RDF Store, using Jena. This class should not be exposed in the API; use the Shard interface. An RDFShard works by taking Shard method calls and QueryTerm objects and translating these to SPARQL queries - see RDFQuery This means that clients have different options for accessing an OBD DataStore; they can use the OBDAPI stack (java API calls on Shard objects, or RESTful URLs for accessing OBDXML) or they can use the semantic web stack (Jena API calls or SPARQL queries, for example via a Joseki-hosted SPARQL endpoint). This is analagous to the situation with the OBDSQLShard, where SQL can be used.

Author:
cjm

getAnnotationGraphAroundNode

public Graph getAnnotationGraphAroundNode(java.lang.String id,
                                          Shard.EntailmentUse entailment,
                                          Shard.GraphTranslation gea)
Description copied from class: AbstractShard
for a COI, this builds the following graph: R(A,X) where R'(E,AC),R''(AC,COI) union R(A,COI) this is typically large: for all annotated entities in the graph, we fetch all the surrounding relations, not just those in the path to COI

Specified by:
getAnnotationGraphAroundNode in interface AnnotationRepository
Overrides:
getAnnotationGraphAroundNode in class AbstractShard
Parameters:
id - For example: an ontology class unique ID
Returns:
given a node (eg a class in an ontology), return a graph centered around this node, including annotation to nodes subsumed by this node

getStatements

public java.util.Collection<Statement> getStatements(java.lang.String sourceId)
Description copied from interface: Shard
fetches all statements from a particular source. All statements, whether LinkStatements or LiteralStatements, should have some source. This may be identical to the source of the node, or it may be separate (for example, it is valid for a non_OMIM source to annotate an OMIM ID).

Caution: may return multiple results

Specified by:
getStatements in interface Shard
Overrides:
getStatements in class AbstractShard
Parameters:
sourceId - a unique global identifier for the source. E.g. OMIM
Returns:
all statements that have this source

getStatementsByQuery

public java.util.Collection<Statement> getStatementsByQuery(QueryTerm queryTerm)
Description copied from interface: QueryableRepository
given a query, find matching statements from shard

Example: LinkQueryTerm partOfNucleusQuery = new LinkQueryTerm(partOf, new LabelQueryTerm(AliasType.ANY_LABEL, "nucleus")); stmts = shard.getStatementsByQuery(new AnnotationLinkQueryTerm(partOfNucleusQuery));

Specified by:
getStatementsByQuery in interface QueryableRepository
Returns:
non-null Collection of any kind of Statement
See Also:
QueryTest

getStatementsByNode

public java.util.Collection<Statement> getStatementsByNode(java.lang.String id)
Description copied from interface: BasicRepository
fetches all statements about an entity, identified by some node ID

Here "about" corresponds to "subject" in RDF terminology. Each Statement has a subject -- what the statement is about.

Specified by:

Overrides:
